task_description:
Section 88 Completeness Check

Review the application against s88 Resource Management Act requirements:

  • Application form complete with all required fields
  • Assessment of Environmental Effects (AEE) provided (if required)
  • Site plans, elevations, and floor plans attached
  • Written approvals from affected parties (if applicable)
  • Certificates of title for subject property
  • Evidence of landowner consent (if applicant is not owner)
  • Specialist reports (if required by zone or overlay)

If incomplete: Contact applicant via RFI or phone to request missing information.

Request: {{doc.request_number}} | Applicant: {{doc.applicant_name}}

Fee Payment Verification

Confirm that the lodgement fee has been paid:

  • Check payment records in finance system
  • Verify amount matches fee schedule for this consent type
  • If deposit model, ensure initial deposit received

If unpaid: Contact applicant to arrange payment before processing can begin.

Note: Statutory clock does not start until fee is paid (unless waived by council policy).

Planner Assignment

Review planner workloads and assign this application based on:

  • Expertise: Building vs Resource Consent specialization
  • Current workload: Number of active applications
  • Complexity: Match complex applications to senior planners
  • Location: If planner has local knowledge of area

Update: Set 'Assigned To' field in Request to the selected planner.

task_title: Send acknowledgment email with statutory clock notice
task_description:
Acknowledgment Email

Email the applicant confirming receipt and clock start:

  • Acknowledgment of application received
  • Statutory clock start date and time
  • Assigned planner name and contact details
  • Estimated processing timeframe ({{project.statutory_clock_days}} working days)
  • What to expect next (assessment, possible RFI, notification decision)

Template: Use 'Resource Consent Acknowledgment' email template.

CC: Agent (if appointed)

task_title: Assess compliance with district plan zone rules
task_description:
District Plan Assessment

Review the application against district plan zone-specific rules:

  1. Identify Zone: Confirm property zoning from GIS/property record
  2. Determine Activity Status: Is the activity Permitted/Controlled/Restricted Discretionary/Discretionary/Non-Complying?
  3. Rule Compliance: Check compliance with:
    • Height limits
    • Setbacks and boundaries
    • Site coverage
    • Parking requirements
    • Outdoor living space
    • Any zone-specific rules
  4. Identify Infringements: List all rule breaches
  5. Matters of Discretion: If Restricted Discretionary, identify relevant matters

Property: {{doc.property_address}} | Zone: {{doc.zoning}}

task_title: Check overlay compliance (heritage, flood, ecological, cultural)
task_description:
Overlay Assessment

If the property has overlays, assess compliance with overlay-specific requirements:

  • Heritage Overlay: Heritage NZ consent required? Heritage assessment report provided?
  • Natural Hazard Overlays: Flood zone, liquefaction, slope instability - geotechnical assessment required?
  • Ecological Overlays: Significant Natural Areas - ecological impact assessment required?
  • Sites of Significance to Māori: Cultural impact assessment? Iwi consultation undertaken?
  • Notable Trees: Arborist report if works near protected trees?

Action: If additional specialist reports are required, issue RFI or confirm reports are already included in application.

task_title: Assess actual and potential environmental effects
task_description:
Section 104(1)(a) Effects Assessment

Assess the actual and potential effects on the environment:

  1. Adjoining Properties:
    • Privacy (overlooking)
    • Sunlight access and shading
    • Visual amenity and character
    • Noise during construction and operation
  2. Infrastructure Effects:
    • Traffic generation and parking adequacy
    • Stormwater management and runoff
    • Water supply and wastewater capacity
    • Network utility impacts
  3. Natural Environment:
    • Ecological values (flora/fauna)
    • Watercourses and wetlands
    • Soil stability and erosion
  4. Cultural/Heritage:
    • Heritage values
    • Sites of significance to Māori
    • Archaeological sites

Determine: Are effects less than minor, minor, or more than minor? This informs notification decision under s95.

task_title: Identify affected parties and assess written approvals
task_description:
Affected Parties Assessment (s95E)

Determine who is adversely affected by the proposal:

  1. Identify Affected Persons:
    • Adjacent property owners directly impacted
    • Neighbors within notification radius (if applicable)
    • Network utility operators
    • Iwi (if cultural sites affected)
  2. Degree of Effect: For each affected party, assess:
    • Nature of adverse effect
    • Magnitude of effect (minor or more than minor)
  3. Written Approvals: Check if applicant has obtained written approvals:
    • Review approval forms for validity
    • Confirm affected persons have approved the specific effects
    • Note: approval must be from the person, not just landowner

Outcome: List all affected persons and approval status. This directly impacts s95 notification decision.

Specialist Report Review

If specialist reports are provided, review for adequacy:

  • Traffic Assessment: Prepared by suitably qualified traffic engineer? Addresses trip generation, parking, site access?
  • Geotechnical Report: From certified geotechnical engineer? Addresses site stability, liquefaction, foundation design?
  • Acoustic Assessment: From acoustic specialist? Addresses construction and operational noise against district plan standards?
  • Stormwater Design: From engineer? Addresses runoff, detention, water quality?
  • Ecological Assessment: From qualified ecologist? Addresses indigenous vegetation, habitat values, offset/mitigation?
  • Heritage Impact Assessment: From heritage professional? Addresses effects on heritage values?

If reports are inadequate: Issue RFI requesting additional information or clarification.

task_title: Conduct site visit and contextual assessment
task_description:
Site Visit

Visit the site to verify application details and assess context:

  1. Verify Existing Conditions:
    • Confirm existing buildings match application description
    • Check property boundaries and dimensions
    • Assess current land use and activities
  2. Assess Context:
    • Character of surrounding area
    • Neighboring buildings and setbacks
    • Views to/from site
    • Access and parking situation
  3. Assess Effects:
    • Potential shading on neighbors
    • Privacy/overlooking issues
    • Visual dominance or bulk
  4. Take Photos: Document existing conditions and context

Note: Site visit is not always required for minor applications. Use professional judgment.

Preliminary Assessment Summary

Document your preliminary assessment findings:

  1. Summary of Proposal: Brief description of what is proposed
  2. Rule Compliance:
    • Activity status determination
    • List of rule infringements (if any)
    • Matters of discretion (if restricted discretionary)
  3. Effects Summary:
    • Key effects on environment
    • Overall magnitude (less than minor / minor / more than minor)
  4. Issues Identified: Any concerns or problems with the application
  5. Information Gaps: Is an RFI needed? What additional information is required?
  6. Preliminary View on Notification: Initial thoughts on whether this should be non-notified/limited/public

Next Steps: If RFI is needed, prepare to issue it. If application is complete, proceed to s95 determination.

task_title: Draft consent conditions with s108AA justification
task_description:
Draft Conditions of Consent (s108AA)

Draft conditions that meet s108AA requirements:

Each condition must:

  • Serve a purpose listed in s108AA(1)(a)
  • Relate to the subject matter of the consent
  • Be reasonably necessary

Standard Conditions:

  • Consent duration and expiry
  • Lapsing (s125) - when consent lapses if not given effect to
  • Review conditions (s128)
  • Consent notice requirements (if applicable)

Specific Conditions to Mitigate Effects:

  • Design/location conditions (if visual effects)
  • Construction management (if construction noise/traffic)
  • Landscaping/screening (if privacy/visual effects)
  • Stormwater controls (if stormwater effects)
  • Noise limits (if operational noise)
  • Monitoring and reporting requirements

Use: Condition library templates where applicable. Customize to specific effects identified in assessment.

task_title: Senior planner reviews assessment and recommendation
task_description:
Peer Review Quality Check

Senior Planner to review the assessment and recommendation for quality and defensibility:

  1. Statutory Assessment Completeness:
    • All s104 matters addressed (effects, district plan, Part 2)
    • Notification decision (s95) properly documented
    • Affected parties appropriately considered (s95E)
  2. Effects Assessment Adequacy:
    • All relevant effects identified and assessed
    • Assessment is robust and defensible
    • Magnitude of effects appropriately characterized
  3. Conditions:
    • Each condition has clear s108AA justification
    • Conditions are enforceable and measurable
    • Conditions address identified effects
  4. Recommendation:
    • Recommendation (approve/decline) is justified
    • Consistent with assessment
    • Legally defensible if appealed

Provide Feedback: Note any issues or improvements needed. Discuss with processing planner.

Manager Decision Sign-Off

Team Leader or Manager to review and approve final decision:

  1. Review Final Assessment: Read planner's report and senior planner's peer review comments
  2. Confirm Recommendation: Agree with recommended decision (approve/decline)
  3. Review Proposed Conditions: Ensure conditions are appropriate and justified
  4. Delegation Check: Confirm decision is within delegated authority (check delegation register)
  5. Sign Decision: Electronically sign or authorize the decision

If Declined: Ensure reasons are clearly articulated and legally defensible.

If Approved with Conditions: Ensure all conditions meet s108AA tests.

If Outside Delegation: Refer to hearings panel or commissioner.

task_title: Generate and issue Notice of Decision to applicant
task_description:
Issue Notice of Decision

Generate the formal Notice of Decision and send to applicant:

  1. Generate NOD: Use Notice of Decision template with:
    • Decision outcome (Approved/Approved with Conditions/Declined)
    • Reasons for decision (reference to s104, Part 2, district plan)
    • Conditions of consent (if approved with conditions)
    • Lapse date (calculate from commencement)
    • Duration/expiry date
    • Appeal rights notice (s120 RMA - 15 working days)
    • Advice notes
  2. Quality Check: Proofread NOD for errors or inconsistencies
  3. Email to Applicant:
    • Attach PDF of Notice of Decision
    • CC to agent (if appointed)
    • Use 'Decision Issued' email template
  4. Update Records:
    • Mark request as 'Decision Issued' in workflow
    • Stop statutory clock
    • Upload NOD to document repository

Next: Monitor for appeal period (15 working days). If no appeal, decision becomes final.
